item.title: ManyClasses1 Complete
item.description: The ManyClasses1 Project is Officially Complete!

item.title: ManyClasses Data Collection Progress
item.description: Data from the ManyClasses 1 Experiment are almost all in!

item.title: ManyClasses Q-and-A on the Learning Curve
item.description: Q&A about ManyClasses with Emily Fyfe and Ben Motz on the Learning Curve Blog

item.title: ManyClasses 1 In-Principle Acceptance!
item.description: The registered report for the first ManyClasses study has been in-principle accepted!

item.title: ManyClasses 1 Application Summary
item.description: This update summarizes the applications received for the first ManyClasses study.

item.title: IRB Approval, Again! â€”and Letters from the Principal
item.description: This update discusses some of the challenges of distributing an experiment in classrooms across institutional boundaries, and how we have designed the ManyClasses 1 study to address these challenges.

item.title: IRB Approval!
item.description: The IU IRB has approved the ManyClasses 1 protocol!

item.title: Not whether, but where: Scaling-up how we think about effects and relationships in natural educational contexts
item.description: Preprint of paper to be presented at SASLAS19, and appearing in the companion proceedings of the 9th International Learning Analytics and Knowledge Conference (LAK19).

item.title: Encrypted Consent: A tool for ManyClasses research
item.description: Students participating in ManyClasses 1 need to be given the option to provide informed consent, but ideally instructors should not know which students have consented to participate. We created a tool to enable encrypted consent.

item.title: ManyClasses: A model for abstracting generalizable research principles from different learning contexts
item.description: We presented a vision for ManyClasses research at the replicate.education workshop at Education Data Mining 2018.

item.title: ManyClasses 1: Call for Applications
item.description: What is ManyClasses? What is the purpose of this ManyClasses 1 study? Who is eligible to apply? What is expected of selected instructors? What are the potential benefits for selected instructors? What is expected of students in participating classes? How will participating classes be selected? Who is running this project? Who do I contact if I have questions? What is ManyClasses? ManyClasses is a collaborative research project investigating the generalizability of educational practices across a variety of authentic college classes.
